intro: Pentaphyllum strigosum, commonly known as the roughstem cow-wheat, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its stems are often covered in stiff, glandular hairs, giving it a rough texture. The flowers are small and clustered, usually in whorls, and are typically pink or purple in color.
